intro: Clidemia auricoma, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
